unnormalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Data Plan Overhaul Amidst 5G Expansion**
normalised: **Telecommunications Sector Sees Data Plan Overhaul Amidst Five G Expansion**

unnormalised: New Delhi: Leading telecom operators, including Airtel and Jio, are reportedly revising their data plans in response to the ongoing 5G rollout across India. Industry analysts predict increased competition and potential price adjustments in the coming months.
normalised: New Delhi: Leading telecom operators, including Airtel and Jio, are reportedly revising their data plans in response to the ongoing five G rollout across India. Industry analysts predict increased competition and potential price adjustments in the coming months.

unnormalised: Dr. Meena Sharma, a professor at IIT Bombay specializing in telecommunications policy, stated, "The current data plans, many offering limited data at high Rs./GB, are unsustainable in the 5G era."
normalised: Doctor Meena Sharma, a professor at I I T Bombay specializing in telecommunications policy, stated, "The current data plans, many offering limited data at high rupees per G B, are unsustainable in the five G era."

unnormalised: A recent TRAI report highlighted that average data consumption has surged by 60% in the last year, particularly in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities like Lucknow and Patna.
normalised: A recent T R A I report highlighted that average data consumption has surged by sixty percent in the last year, particularly in Tier two and Tier three cities like Lucknow and Patna.

unnormalised: Operators are also exploring bundled offerings, including OTT subscriptions and cloud storage, to attract and retain subscribers. Jio Platforms recently announced a strategic partnership with DesiFlix, an Indian streaming service, offering bundled access with select data plans.
normalised: Operators are also exploring bundled offerings, including O T T subscriptions and cloud storage, to attract and retain subscribers. Jio Platforms recently announced a strategic partnership with DesiFlix, an Indian streaming service, offering bundled access with select data plans.

unnormalised: Analysts at Motilal Oswal Financial Services predict a churn of around 15% among users currently on older 4G plans. Many are expected to upgrade to 5G-enabled smartphones and higher data allowances. Future plans are expected to offer coverage extending to even the most remote areas like Ladakh, increasing coverage by 3000 sq ft. The revised plans are expected to be announced before Diwali.
normalised: Analysts at Motilal Oswal Financial Services predict a churn of around fifteen percent among users currently on older four G plans. Many are expected to upgrade to five G enabled smartphones and higher data allowances. Future plans are expected to offer coverage extending to even the most remote areas like Ladakh, increasing coverage by three thousand square feet. The revised plans are expected to be announced before Diwali.
